definitions.definition: (grammar) A word that modifies a noun or describes a noun’s referent.
definitions.example: The words “big” and “heavy” are English adjectives.

definitions.definition: To make an adjective of; to form or convert into an adjective.
(chiefly as a participle) To characterize with an adjective; to describe by using an adjective.
(grammar) Adjectival; pertaining to or functioning as an adjective.
Applying to methods of enforcement and rules of procedure.
(of a dye) Needing the use of a mordant to be made fast to that which is being dyed.
